content:
The Spirit of Speyside Whisky Festival is an annual event that takes place in Moray, Scotland, and is dedicated to celebrating Scotland's national drink, whisky. The festival began in 1999 and has since become a popular event for whisky lovers and connoisseurs from all over the world.

During the festival, visitors can attend various events and tastings, including distillery tours, whisky and food pairings, masterclasses, seminars, and traditional ceilidh dances. The festival features over 60 distilleries, including some of the most famous ones in the world, such as Glenfiddich, The Macallan, and The Glenlivet.

The 2021 festival is scheduled to take place from November 3-8 and will feature in-person and virtual events. Due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, some events may have limited capacity or require pre-registration, so it's important to check the official festival website for the latest information and guidelines.

I hope this information is helpful. Let me know if you have any other questions.
